title: Instructional Design Strategies for Science Education Based on Cognitive Load Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational educational theory and general understanding of cognitive science
context.additional_context: Targeting beginner-level learners interested in science education design and application. Conducted via real-time video conferencing tools.

learning_goals: Can explain core principles of Cognitive Load Theory (intrinsic/extraneous/germane load)
Can apply CLT-based instructional design strategies (e.g., segmented learning, visual-verbal integration) to science education content
Can measure learner cognitive load using formative assessment tools in online environments

resources: Communicative Language Teaching (CLT) Case Study Materials

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
